pageContext.claim: “Just like the NFL, whose ratings have gone WAY DOWN, Nike is getting absolutely killed with anger and boycotts. I wonder if they had any idea that it would be this way? As far as the NFL is concerned, I just find it hard to watch, and always will, until they stand for the FLAG!”
pageContext.analysis: Nike unveiled a big ad campaign featuring Colin Kaepernick, the NFL player Trump has criticized for kneeling during the national anthem as a way to protest police abuses of African Americans. Trump tweeted this claim after an initial stock tumble, but Nike recovered all its losses and its stock is now worth more than ever, while online sales soared more than 30 percent after the first Kaepernick ads. The TV audience size for NFL games is down this year, but it’s unclear exactly why, and there's no direct connection to the anthem protests. “Average attendance at regular season NFL games last year was the highest since 2007, when the NFL set an all-time record in attendance. The NFL says ticket sales are 'on par' with last year,” according to the Associated Press. Professional football games remain among the most-watched televised events, the AP reported.
